ref: 3457 kēkara ʻ squinting, cross -- eyed ʼ Mn. (iii 159 as v.l.), ˚aka -- Cāṇ., kēdara -- lex. [Connexion with other words for ʻ crooked, squinting ʼ suggested by EWA i 264, in rejecting IE. origin with Lat. caecus etc., is doubtful. But if kēkara -- is deriv. of *kēka -- < IE. *kaiko IEW 519, there is a parallel formation in *ḍēvva -- ~ ḍēvvara -- and the same semantic range ʻ one -- eyed -- blind -- squinting ʼ in *śrēḍa -- . -- See ṭēraka -- , ṭagara -- 1, *ḍēra -- 1, *ḍhēra -- 2, *trēḍḍa -- , *trēḍḍha -- ]
